comments:
The environment PATH variable is now included as part of the java.library.path
that gets passed to ant when running a target.  

If there are quotes around an entry in this variable, eclipse does not escape
them properly which makes the process fail with a "Java Virtual Machine
Launcher" error. The message in the error is "Cannot find main class. program
will exit".

example of bad path entry:
PATH="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\VSS\win32";
Thanks Jonathan..I am able to reproduce.

Fixed in AntLaunchDelegate to handle quoted path entries.

To workaround this problem in M7, you can turn off "Set an Input Handler" on 
the Main page of the Ant launch configuration.

Verified. Minor comment on the code: I don't think you ever need to break out of
the default case.
*** Bug 95717 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This workaround doesn't work. I unchecked "Set an Input Handler" in the Main 
tab of the ANT config, even restartet Eclipse, but the same error keeps 
occuring when starting an ANT target:

    "Could not find the main class. Programm will exit."
